conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is elevated/angled with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D execution: consistent wall solids, clear floor plane, good corner geometry, and clean roof cutaway with an isometric-like viewing angle.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Major layout fidelity issues versus the 2D plan: key labeled spaces (e.g., dining room/playroom/pantry relationships) are not clearly preserved, and an apparent bedroom-like space appears that is not present in the 2D plan. Overall adjacency and room configuration do not match well.

interior_elements.notes: Furniture and fixtures are present (sofa, bed, kitchen counters/island, some bath elements), but several elements appear assigned to rooms that don't exist in the 2D plan (e.g., bedroom), reducing plan-to-render correspondence.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and readable geometry with good lighting; openings and wall boundaries are generally distinguishable. No obvious mesh breakage or UI/text contamination.

detected_errors.description: One or more major rooms/spaces from the 2D plan (notably dining room/playroom/pantry configuration) are missing or not represented in the correct location/relationship in the 3D model.
Overall room adjacency and layout proportions deviate substantially from the 2D plan; the 3D model appears to follow a different arrangement in several areas.
Door/window placements and opening orientations cannot be reliably matched to the 2D plan; several openings appear inconsistent with the source walls.
Furniture set includes room types not indicated on the 2D plan (e.g., bedroom), weakening room identity matching.

summary: A clearly valid cutaway 3D model with strong rendering/clarity, but the spatial layout and key room relationships do not closely match the provided 2D floor plan.
